title: The Holiday Travel Crush Has Begun. Are the Airlines Up to It?
content: Thanksgiving will be the biggest test of the system’s resilience since the pandemic began, with millions more passengers than last year.

more_info.byline: By Sydney Ember and Niraj Chokshi

title: Two Fox News Contributors Quit in Protest of Tucker Carlson’s Jan. 6 Special
content: Jonah Goldberg and Stephen Hayes, stars of a brand of conservatism that has fallen out of fashion, decide they’ve had enough.

title: Jeff Bezos gives $100 million to the Obama Foundation.
content: The gift was the largest yet for the foundation and was among several splashy donations in recent months by Mr. Bezos, one of the world’s richest people.

org_facet: Obama, Barack H, Presidential Library and Museum

title: Family Unvisited, Travel a No-Go: The Hard Costs of High Gas Prices
content: They hit their highest level since 2014 last month, forcing Americans to rejigger household budgets and forgo leisure activities.

more_info.byline: By Emma Goldberg, Coral Murphy Marcos and Kellen Browning

title: How Do You Make Teen Comedies Today? Buy a High School.
content: A former school outside Syracuse, N.Y., has been transformed into American High, a production hub for inexpensive films aimed at streaming platforms.

title: Buy Stocks to Prosper. Buy Bonds to Sleep at Night.
content: Do what it takes to stay invested in the stock market, our columnist says. Government bonds may help, even if they look unappealing now.

title: How to Beat Retirement’s Nemesis: Inflation
content: With prices rising at their fastest rate in decades, people in retirement or approaching it should take extra care to protect their savings.

title: U.S. Returns Over 900 Confiscated Artifacts to Mali
content: A Homeland Security investigation had discovered funerary objects, Neolithic relics and more in a shipping container in 2009.

title: Elizabeth Holmes Hones Her Defense in Day 2 of Testimony
content: Ms. Holmes, the founder of the disgraced blood testing start-up Theranos, pointed blame at others and said her company had worked with drug makers.

more_info.byline: By Erin Griffith and Erin Woo

title: Kevin Spacey was ordered to pay $31 million to the ‘House of Cards’ studio after sexual harassment allegations.
content: A secret arbitrator’s ruling was issued 13 months ago and became public on Monday when lawyers for the studio petitioned a California court to confirm the award.

title: How Fake News on Facebook Helped Fuel a Border Crisis in Europe
content: Social media worsened a migrant crisis on the border of Belarus and Poland and helped smugglers profit off desperate people trying to reach Europe.

more_info.byline: By Andrew Higgins, Adam Satariano and Jane Arraf
des_facet: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

title: Behind the Powell pick: a bet the economy has room to grow and inflation will fade.
content: President Biden views the incumbent Fed chair as sharing his values on price growth and the pursuit of a lower unemployment rate to help Black, Hispanic and other marginalized workers.

title: Hundreds Line Up as Britain’s First Popeyes Opens
content: On Saturday, curious customers waited for hours at an East London shopping mall to get a taste of the Louisiana-based restaurant’s fried chicken.

more_info.byline: By Jenny Gross and Chris Stanford

title: Athenahealth’s $17 billion takeover is the latest private equity megadeal.
content: Hellman & Friedman and Bain Capital are taking over the health care software company.

more_info.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

title: Netflix buys a visual effects company in a move to support its global ambitions.
content: Terms of the deal were not disclosed, but the company, Scanline VFX, will continue to operate independently.

title: $15 minimum wage for federal contractors will take effect Jan. 30.
content: The Labor Department issued a final rule carrying out an April executive order from President Biden. It could affect more than 300,000 workers.

title: Alden Global Capital makes an offer for Lee Enterprises, a big newspaper chain.
content: The hedge fund, which owns about 200 papers and bought Tribune Publishing this year, bid $141 million for Lee, which publishes 90 dailies.

title: Elizabeth Warren says she will oppose Jerome Powell’s nomination, even as top Democrats express support.
content: “I will vote against him,” the senator said in a statement, but other powerful lawmakers said his reappointment would provide economic stability.

more_info.byline: By Ana Swanson and Emily Cochrane

title: Biden Bets Big on Continuity at the Fed
content: Jerome Powell and Lael Brainard are known quantities in a turbulent time.

title: Concerns Grow Over Safety of Aduhelm After Death of Patient Who Got the Drug
content: Newly published safety data shows that 41 percent of patients in key clinical trials of the Alzheimer’s drug experienced brain bleeding or swelling, though many cases were asymptomatic.

title: Brooklyn Museum to Receive $50 Million Gift From City of New York
content: The funding will be the largest capital investment in the museum’s nearly 200-year history.

title: Target makes Thanksgiving closings permanent.
content: “What started as a temporary measure driven by the pandemic is now our new standard,” Brian Cornell, Target’s C.E.O., said.

title: Lael Brainard is tapped for vice chair of the Federal Reserve.
content: The longtime Washington insider is now the central bank’s No. 2. That could give her more bandwidth to influence policy.

more_info.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Madeleine Ngo

title: Biden Sticks With Powell as Fed Chair, Resisting Political Pressure
content: The White House returned to a longstanding pattern in which presidents reappoint the same leader of the Federal Reserve regardless of partisan identity.

more_info.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Jim Tankersley

title: Elizabeth Holmes resumes her testimony in her fraud trial.
content: The founder of Theranos unexpectedly took the stand in her own defense on Friday, the latest twist in a trial that has captivated Silicon Valley.

title: The Stakes Behind Elizabeth Holmes’s Taking the Stand
content: The Theranos founder surprised many by testifying in her fraud trial.

more_info.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Jason Karaian, Sarah Kessler, Stephen Gandel, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni

title: The Searing Beauty, and Harsh Reality, of a Kentucky Tobacco Harvest
content: At a family farm in Shelby County, a group of 26 men from Nicaragua and Mexico perform the grueling seasonal work that Americans largely avoid.

title: Taxi! To the Airport — by Air, Please.
content: Several companies are betting they can bring electric urban air travel to the masses — perhaps within the next few years.

title: Netflix Turns Its Attention to Films It Hopes Everyone Wants to See
content: The streaming service wants to be more than a place where big names bring passion projects studios have passed on. It’s now trying to make the kind of blockbusters normally seen in theaters.

title: The Week in Business: Biden’s Safety Net Package Clears One Hurdle
content: The president signed the $1.2 trillion infrastructure bill. Retail sales are up and signs point to a strong holiday season. And the next Fed chair could be named any day.

title: Hair Curlers in Public? That’s Just How They Roll.
content: The young South Korean women who wear them say they are not only functional, but also a sign of shifting ideas about beauty and a reflection of the country’s generational divide.
